intro: Succisella microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed succisella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and small, fleshy leaves. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, often blooming in spring. Due to its unique appearance and habitat preferences, it is a sought-after plant among succulent enthusiasts.
